{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3540321,"name":"Jugad S.","username":"jsingh","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c37758/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-25T21:47:22.096Z","cooked":"

Hello,
Recently, we’ve been having an issue where our Limelight feed crashes. This is completely random and if it happens when we can see an apriltag, it messes up our odometry, auto-alignment, and other important things. We saw on CD that there are a lot of teams that have struggled with this, but they were all using USB cameras. We aren’t. We have implemented a decrease in our usage of Network Tables, which lessened the frequency of the issue, but didn’t eradicate it. We checked the DS Logs and nothing is abnormal. Here’s a link to our code.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.
~Jugad, 1391

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-25T21:47:22.096Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":18.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":493212,"topic_slug":"ll3g-stream-crashes","display_username":"Jugad S.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/jugads/1391_2025/tree/Autos/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"1391_2025/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems at Autos · jugads/1391_2025 · GitHub","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ll3g-stream-crashes/493212/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3540335,"name":"","username":"Crafter","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/77aa72/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-25T21:56:31.034Z","cooked":"

If you’re running 2025.1, reflash the OS. Limelight recently fixed some connection issues with a pre-release version of that build.

Hi,
Thanks for your response! We did end up reflashing the firmware, but this issue is still happening. It’s not very common, but it happens 2-3 times in a day which is still a problem, especially when running autonomous.
Thank you!

Alright, make sure your connections are secure and that your Limelight isn’t losing power due to a loose connection or a brownout.
